channel.title: unity on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist
channel.description: Recent content in unity on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist

item.title: difficulty setting and play time integration
item.description: reintroduced the coding for difficulty setting and programmed a play time clock, so that I can finally see how long the gameplay itself is added the ticker to the menu and save file displays, although doing so required rebuilding a bit of the player’s prefab and animator graph.

item.title: depressive boon?
item.description: was feeling the typical Sunday Sadness, so I fired up the PC to try and catch up on some of the work from last week I was planning on redoing this week.

item.title: wasted week
item.description: something I did broke the save system, not really sure what exactly, so I’ve backed everything up as it was broken and am restoring last week’s backup, which seems to work.

item.title: difficulty level reckoning
item.description: after a bit of first hand experience during my time away from the project with difficulty level, I have decided that a traditional system is indeed needed for my own game.

item.title: the headless woman & the skip button
item.description: it had been awhile since I modeled a human from scratch, so I started one to use as the final boss; shake things up a bit from the machines. progress is going smoothly, mainly because my references seem to be well crafted added a skip button for the dialogue, in case people like to die quickly and numerously.

item.title: slowly regaining momentum
item.description: it is beginning to happen though added a data privacy button for opting out and lighting effects for the desert world

item.title: feeling lousy
item.description: two or three days of depression, so I’m working on a holiday. at least it is my least favorite one, maybe second to new year’s, i suppose didn’t really do much.

item.title: swapped scripting backend
item.description: what a rough day i remember it being tricky to go back and forth between scripting backend types (mono, IL2CPP) and needing the internet to do so, but I don’t recall having so many problems!

item.title: with the cadence of peter lorre
item.description: what feels like an endless endeavour is slowly grinding along. better late than never, at least that’s what they say. finally published the second demo to the Google Play app store for internal testing phase 2.

item.title: painting giant beam particle textures
item.description: spent the whole week painting textures and creating shaders for the big attack for the primary attack of the second boss. had some issues with photoshop’s recognition of my wacom tablets pressure sensitivity, it was weird and I could have swore it was working.

item.title: boss ship 2 rigged
item.description: finally started setting up the second boss, it is tougher going than I had anticipated. for whatever reason, it doesn’t feel like I gave as much consideration beforehand to exactly how this particular boss would articulate what its possible attack patterns may be I then began to realise I hadn’t decided where either of the remaining two boss’ weaknesses were going to be located either.

item.title: sporadic progression
item.description: have only been able to manage to be productive every other week or so. today was the first day i felt like I worked a real day all year the terrain for planet 3 is almost done after around one full day’s work, just the baking left to do, but I have many adjustments that are still pending testing still really difficult to make myself play the game to test things.

item.title: immense suffering
item.description: have been doing terrible, but slowly getting back in the swing of things fixed a few bugs this week that weren’t game breaking and as such have been lingering around for a year or more.

item.title: mildly winning
item.description: so, i didn’t do anything today, but the rest of the week has been most productive! i’m talking big bugs with single lines; it feels like the home stretch, but honestly it looks halfway there.

item.title: lengthy lapse
item.description: haven’t been able to force myself to work on the game for quite some time, have been on a sort of hiatus added changes to correct the energy ability items/shield ability bug, as well as fixed the energy meter spending and shield ability consumption added reset trigger parameter to player animator controller to facilitate the above basically, the animator Rebind function was resetting the animator parameters too, which i use for the shield ability.

item.title: ouchie
item.description: difficult day thought i had the new item ability system working before the weekend five hours of work later today, i think it is working. at first i thought the static variables i was using were the problem, but i ended up keeping them.

item.title: many changes, most recent: item ability functional
item.description: it actually seems to work… at first test… i just can’t use old save data. idk how imma add shit and not break the save data signature… i didn’t even change it, but old files load funny.

item.title: la, la, bumba
item.description: i changed like a million things to fix a hundred… if that isn’t a saying, quote me. idk what to even test anymore december I am supposed to add all these people… the weapon change system seems good… recent adjustments to equipment strength seems appropriate… i need to figure out the relic/accessories, the ability system… what am I missing?

item.title: boss ship 3 model complete
item.description: got the model imported, all the materials setup and the textures compressed. still need to program the fight and do attack animations

item.title: holy wasted week Batman!
item.description: finished laying out the base colors for boss ship 3 in zbrush, still need to paint the decals and decimate also think the weapon effect system is working, managed to figure out a way to set the default effect when unequipping a weapon altogether, which of course wasn’t as difficult of a problem as it seemed to be, once i had written the code supposed to test the stage progression system a bit this weekend, maybe i should add in a third type first… it is good to be feeling motivated again!

item.title: groovy
item.description: actually opened up zbrush this week and got the model imported, the project started. also, started work on the weapon effect system was harder than expected to get a prototype working.

item.title: bday vacay
item.description: so, almost done with my month long birthday break it officially began april 23 to play the Nier remake, still did a few things during it though edited the spawn textures for world 0, section 1 to adjust for difficulty need to start modeling items and get on with it

item.title: second section of first star world prototype
item.description: laid out spawn textures will probably need to refine ha, this is a haiku

item.title: spaceship 07 in game
item.description: another unproductive feeling week. how long did this damn model even take? has it been forever? it feels like it need to test the game and pivot back to programming next week.

item.title: cusp versus edge: fight!
item.description: life is so difficult to navigate lately… this is coming from someone who doesn’t go anywhere or do anything except live his pursuit i am either on the cusp of something brilliant, some huge revelation or new threshold of understanding; or at the edge of some immeasurable disaster, a great unravelling of everything i have known or built and perhaps disillusion of everything that may ever come to be it is tough to say, maybe I don’t wanna label it, or speak the thought into existence progress is coming along well on the seventh spaceship.

item.title: moving forward
item.description: feeling rather unproductive, but slowly trudging along… been learning about and implementing preprocessor directives as i finish off the massive stage progression system update and world section integration, which i am still hoping will work out okay in the end; it seems to be so far the preprocessor clauses should prevent a bit of user (developer?

item.title: testing huge rewrite
item.description: finally got what i am hoping to be the major changes involved in this “huge rewrite” completed and have started testing. lots and lots of notes/bugs already, it is hard to feel like i am making progress, but these things should have been this way from the start.

item.title: huge rewrite in progress
item.description: making everything the way it should have always been. am learning a lot and also realizing how much i have already. you know you wrote some sexy code, when what you added to the code base is less than you removed and it does MORE stuff… the stuff you really want

item.title: the feeling of fruitlessness
item.description: feeling ultra unmotivated this feels like such a wasted week… or weeks, maybe? i really did do some constructive things, but life is really hard dealing with death. i miss him already.

item.title: hello machines
item.description: i guess the machine learning seminar i took got me thinking started playing with the ML-Agents package in Unity. idk if I am hoping I can somehow program robots to finish the game for me, or if I am just bored and needed some new influx of input it is definitely intriguing and I’m surprised how quickly the agents could outperform me.

item.title: create + learn
item.description: been working on the boss ship 2 model, hi-res almost done changed out my learning.regiment from Unity’s artificial intelligence course to an intro to the ML-Agents package, the hummingbirds. it seems to incorporate new solutions to traditional AI problems, which should keep my brain seeking and growing, while potentially finding some new behavior for an enemy or possibly balancing out some mechanics for the game time will tell, but i feel the influx of new ideas, practices and technologies to be crucial to developing

item.title: long time, no production
item.description: i feel like i’ve lost weeks! in actuality, it’s probably been about a week… in total, over the course of several weeks, but i still feel behind i’ve done numerous things and added functionality that has been on my list for a long time, but i feel like i’m really just avoiding the most pressing concern of modeling more stuff, namely the second boss i did add models for different ore items for selling and did some further delving into the shader graph, to get a more appealing metallic material with just a bit of fresnel from the graph.

item.title: homerun
item.description: got planet 2 rudimentary implementation going. i had a few problems wrapping my head around this particular bit of my old code, due to not having looked at it in almost a year.

item.title: dressed like a cat
item.description: two steps forward and three steps back. seems like every time i fix something, i break it later. why must this be? more problems unequipping things… at least i finally replicated the issue; it will only occur on the first stage.

item.title: level complete 2.0
item.description: the level complete screen now displays loot obtained during the level, it seems to work. the list of lootObtained is in the Playercontroller class and it gets reset in both the Save/ResetStageGrowth methods.

item.title: hey self
item.description: note to self: all hell breaks loose on title and map if the LevelComplete animator parameter is set to displayed i wonder why?

item.title: make it make more sense
item.description: you’d think this sort if thing would be more obvious from a design standpoint, but it’s the kind of thing you need to learn first hand or have previous experience, i guess anyway, after questioning the entire health orb mechanic now that healing inventory items work, i came to the conclusion the drop conditions should just be adjusted.

item.title: help! i can't count
item.description: saturday work have i tried to work on a saturday before and not found success? feels familiar, but i suppose failure in general should… it’s okay, i am not insane yet; but i am getting there.

item.title: slider & input field link script
item.description: worked on a sunday that was probably a mistake feel okay anyway, i like the script i wrote after posting it here, it looks like the entire for loop is unnecessary, after adding in the ValueChanged function maybe i should just keep it as a sort of insurance policy?

item.title: shop system buy interface
item.description: got the UI for the shop system’s buy function pretty much locked down, anchors work for stretching screen width and everything. still need to do the sell portion and write all the functionality, of course; but i feel more confident about it now overall for some reason getting to the point i am now, confounded me for two entire days last week and worried me all weekend.
